Dear Rebecca Limbaugh:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 02/14/2025. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (517) 899-6024.
Sincerely,
Dayna Lamkey, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
CCI Rule 400.4113 Employee records.
(1)An institution shall maintain employee records
for each employee and shall include
documentation of all of the following information
prior to employment or at the time specified in
this rule:
(e) Three dated references which are
obtained prior to employment from
persons unrelated to the employee and
which are less than 12 months old.
1 of 2 Newly hired employee records had 3 references however one was the
applicant’s sister.

CCI Rule 400.4127 Staff to resident ratio
• (4) When residents are asleep or otherwise
outside of the direct supervision of staff, staff
shall perform variable interval, eye-on checks of
residents. The time between the variable interval
checks shall not exceed fifteen minutes.
Agency room check logs were reviewed and were found to consistently fail to
complete 15-minute checks in variable intervals.
Repeat violation, 2024 Interim with a CAP submitted on 4/30/2024.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Technical Assistance was provided to the agency in reference to licensing rule
400.4156. It was observed that the agency was consistently indicating the
report start date as the same date as the end the date of the reporting period
prior to. Agency was advised of the need for accuracy and consistency relative
to report time frames, report dates and signature dates.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• There was no consultation requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows: The

2024 interim report was completed on 04/19/2024 with findings of
noncompliance.
The terms of the corrective action plan have not been consistently met. Although
overall performance of completion of bed checks was improved, there are still
Individual staff failing to complete them at variable intervals within 15 minutes.
It was observed during the Renewal evaluation that the noncompliance remains.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on the review of the facility's
budget and the agency's financial audit.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was completed and submitted for review.
The assessment documented the agency's work at addressing the area of
noncompliance as a result of last year's annual review. The assessment also
indicated an appropriate plan for continued monitoring of compliance. The agency
currently has six youth. The agency is looking to improve training specific to
completion of bed checks.
Staff and Youth Interviews
A total of 3 staff were interviewed during this evaluation. They included the Chief
Administrator, supervisor, and direct care staff. All staff provided positive feedback
regarding their experience working with the agency, the agency's mission, and the
agency's ability to meet the youth's needs.
Three youth were interviewed during the evaluation. All three youth provided
positive feedback regarding their experience at the facility. Each youth provided
positive statements regarding staff and the support they receive in the program.
Description of Agency Walk Through
A walkthrough of the agency was completed during the assessment. The facility
was observed to be well maintained and clean. There were no hazards observed
or concerns to note.

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
